reviews.comment_teaching:
9點堂+神柱, 淨係上過佢幾堂, 所以無咩印象

據我所知, 呢個course以前係有2個Quiz, 由呢個sem開始佢將果2個Quiz改左做2份assignment, 每份佔10%, 合共20% (你無睇錯, 係每份10%)

大部分CHEM courses每份assignment 3%-5%,考試前deadline, 跟住會upload solutions幫你準備考試, 成個安排好合理

佢呢2份assignment就真係世界級, Assignment 1 個deadline係midterm之後2日, 佢話俾多d時間你做喎, 點知個midterm就出返Assignment 1既野, 頂你assignment都未識做, midterm又點會識做? Assignment 2仲衰, deadline係考final果日, 而最好笑既係呢2份assignment都係“佛系assignment” (無答案, 唔出分, 做完攞唔返), 除左攞果20% assignment分之外, 做完之後係乜都學唔到

Midterm前一堂佢上堂果陣show過一份midterm past paper, 呢份野佢唔會upload上網, 不過就算你影低左份野都無咩用, 因為呢份野係無答案既

Final前會upload一份final past paper, 無錯, 呢份野都係無答案既

講真, 睇textbook自學可能仲好

「師者，所以傳道、受業、解惑也。」(師說)

提供答案係解惑既一種方法, 偏偏CHEM Dept 好多instructors就係鍾意唔提供答案, CHEM3320 份past papers係咁, CHEM3555 果7份lab reports都係咁, CHEM4310 既group projects又係咁, 我就係唔識先要睇答案吖嘛, 你地答案都無份, 咁我要你地班instructors黎做咩? 我自己用Google, 睇textbook自學唔好? 各位CHEM major自求多福啦!

reviews.comment_workload:
一份有用既assignment係會出分, 考試前改完俾返你, 就算改唔切都會出答案,佢既目的係幫你理解個course既內容同埋幫你考試既, 而CHEM2310既assignment就啱啱相反, 一份原本應該係幫你準備考試既assignment, 個deadline竟然係考試當日甚至之後, 令到份assignment失去原先既意義, 甚至變成workload既一部分

由於2份assignment都無答案, 而midterm同final又會出返類似assignment既題目, 所以最好都係考之前做完份assignment, 然後搵d勁人對下答案, make sure你考試之前識做assignment既題目

Final可以帶1張A4 size既手寫cheat sheet, 考final之前你有3樣野可以做: 準備cheat sheet, 做佢果份無答案既Assignment 2同埋past paper, 都係記得搵d勁人對下答案先 (呢個sem final份卷有部分題目同past paper好似, 甚至一樣)

Midterm考比較多calculations, final就少d

Lecture 16 is taught by Professor Stefen NAGL instead of Professor CHAN, he has enthusiasm but his English has heavy German accent, so it is a bit difficult to follow.

Professor CHAN talk about a lot of trivia that may or may not appear in the quiz, and the powerpoint is incomplete most of the time in terms of contents. So either take notes and attend lectures, or take a look at the textbook, or do both to fill the gap.
reviews.comment_teaching: I can only assume that in normal teaching mode the lecture would be more exciting, with lab instruments demonstration and other things. But in online mode, it is quite boring to just listen to what equipment is used without letting us see how it is done, therefore less than half of the class attend lectures, unless there was a quiz that day. Occasionally there were live video demonstration but that was either of low quality. I can tell that Professor CHAN was trying his best to make the lectures interesting, but it was difficult to achieve in online setting.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 7 online quizzes (60%) throughout the semester without conducting midterm or final exam. Only 6 of the 7 quizzes would be counted, but most of us( including me) botched the first quiz, so there was no slacking off for me for the rest of the semester.  

Two handwritten assignment (20%)would have to be submitted, it is alright to use ipad to complete the assignment as long as they are handwritten.

One essay assignment(20%) that replace the final exam. You can choose from 3 predetermined topics, and write for at least 4 pages, you can write the essay on computer, unlike the two assignments above.

Bonus Score(+2%): For student who keep answering questions, 2 bonus points would be added to the final grade.

Assignment 2: 9/10   Mean 8/10

reviews.comment_workload:
Most of the time low workload, it is completely acceptable to study a few hours before the quiz, as they are all open book quiz. The essay is a bit difficult, but the submission time was very lenient, which was set at the end of the final exam period.

The most tedious task is the hand written assignment which is just time consuming. You can type on computer much more quickly and effortlessly

reviews.author: Fickdeinemutter
reviews.comment_content:
One of the Awfullest course I have ever taken since secondary school. Obscure teaching foci showcasing a landfill of topics.

Some people, including me, may commonly find that we simply don't know what have been learned from this course as if we have been injected with unknown sedatives and knocked unconscious for some time until being able to wake up after the final.

It's hard to illustrate explicitly, but it may not be necessary to draw characters transparent enough to see their intestines.   

Powerpoints are quite messy. Too much dazzling newspaper clipping between pages, virtually severing the important points and making it really difficult to grasp them.

So many key concepts required for assignments and exams are not included in the lecture slides.

You may argue that learning is a process of self-exploration, but it may not be responsible for a professor to expect the student gets everything on his own, despite it probably being within his capacity, because the student does not only take your course.

All in all, this is the worst course in the 4-year Chemistry curriculum and perhaps throughout my career as a student.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Chan is adorably corpulent. His baldness is funnily obvious that he seems to be an exemplar of a feverishly dedicated scientist having his senescence accelerated by decades.

Listening to his preaching may be kind of enjoyment if your concern is not completely about how good he teaches.

I should be honest to mention, for others' good sake, that he tends to read directly from powerpoints, discouraging student's persistent attendance, except for those who are highly immune to boredom.
reviews.comment_workload: Two assignments, one before mid-term and one before final. They total 20%. Better hand them in on time or it may cost your final grade.

He tries his best to be enthusiastic.

First three or so lectures are absolutely boring, but is more interesting as you learn more instruments and how they work.

His lecture style is pretty similar to any usual professors, talking on the ppt slides and explaining a bit more on the side.

My recommendation is either print out the ppt slide and write on it, or make separate notes, as many parts of what he says (but not on his slides!) are on his quizzes.

He likes getting questions asked either in class or after class, and will happily reply.

reviews.comment_content: Cover almost the entire textbooks. 13 chapters for midterm and about 10 chapters for final. Mostly about understanding and less calculation. Very practical knowledge and not as difficult to understand compared to organic chemistry.
reviews.comment_teaching: Going to his class will be helpful, because the lecture notes itself is quite abstract and not much information written on it. Most of the materials can be understood easily, but sometimes his explanation can be quite long and not so efficient. Asking him questions will help.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 quizzes, midterm and final. The quizzes are quite easy as long as you prepare for it. Midterm is not hard, cover 13 chapters until EDTA but each chapter is very short. For final, 1 paper cheat sheet handwritten is allowed. He puts unexpected questions, last question is designing an experiment for quantitative analysis. But if you go to his class, you probably can guess the compound he is going to ask for the experiment design because he mention in class quite often. Do the past paper because some of the questions are similar.

Either 40% midterm 60% final or 30% midterm, 50% final and 2* 10% for quizzes.

Mean about ~60% for both midterm and final. Not sure about the grading because I did pretty good. 87.6% total grade and got A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Compared to organic chemistry, the workload doesn't feel heavy at all. Maybe preparing for quiz but the materials are easy to understand. Most questions are practical and understanding, so no need to think too much about calculations especially after midterm.

reviews.author: EdogawaC
reviews.title: A whole textbook for one semster is a bit too much!
reviews.comment_content: Almost all chapters from Harris textbook was covered. 13 chapters for mid-term, mostly on data analyses, unit conversions and statistics, but not much calculations. Final was the rest of the chapters, mostly on different analytical techniques, GC, LC, MS etc. Cheat sheet allowed but wasn't too useful,  quite a few questions on parts and functions of analytical instruments which I hated, plus one essay question on devising an experiment.
reviews.comment_teaching: Average, understandable but sometimes it was quite hard to catch everything the instructor said. Lecture notes were typical and not very inspiring, but if you dont pay attention in class there will be areas you won't understand fully, and he would probably test it in exams.
reviews.comment_grading: 2 quizzes, one mid term, one final. Final grade determined by quiz+mid term+final(10,30,60) OR mid-term+final(35,65) if I am not mistaken. Quizzes are not difficult but the questions are quite strangely designed, and sometimes difficult to understand. Both mid term and final did not cover many calculation-type questions, unexpected for an analytical chemistry course.
reviews.comment_workload: Although there is no homework or assignments, those would be very helpful in my opinions, I would prefer to have some homework to consolidate lecture materials instead of being allowed to have cheat sheet. And covering a whole textbook in one course is just too much.
